intake_process: Call (800) 482-2565 (24-hour availability) or contact main office. Veterans Inc. operates Montana services but specific local intake details require direct contact.
service_area: Montana and North Dakota - statewide coverage
notes: Main office in Worcester, MA with Montana and North Dakota service division. Specific Montana office address not published online.

intake_process: Contact by phone or visit Missoula office. SSVF services available for very low-income veteran families who are homeless or at imminent risk of homelessness. Mobile outreach model supports clients across Montana and Wyoming.
service_area: Montana and Wyoming - regional coverage with specific locations in Missoula, Helena, Bozeman, Butte, Great Falls, Kalispell, Miles City, and Wyoming locations
notes: Established 1985 in Sheridan, Wyoming. Multi-location provider with SSVF program across MT and WY. Additional Miles City location: 517 N. Strevell, Miles City MT 59301, (406) 234-2333

org_name: United Way of Forsyth County, Inc.
intake_process: Call (336) 723-3601 to inquire about SSVF program eligibility and begin application process. Case management, housing placement, and temporary financial assistance available.
service_area: Forsyth County, Guilford County, Stokes County, Surry County, and Yadkin County in North Carolina
notes: SSVF program provides rapid re-housing, homelessness prevention, and housing stabilization services for very low-income veteran families.

org_name: Homeward Bound of Western North Carolina, Inc.
intake_process: Call (828) 258-1695 for main office or (828) 772-2847 for Veterans Outreach Program Manager (Alix Doddridge). Walk-in available at Day Center. SSVF services help with rapid re-housing and prevention.
service_area: Buncombe County and Western North Carolina - focused on Asheville metro area
notes: Operating since 1987. Housing First model provider. Additional location: AHOPE Day Center at 14 North Ann Street, Asheville, NC 28801, (828) 252-8883. Veterans can also call Alix Doddridge at (828) 772-2847.

intake_process: Call SSVF intake line at (704) 370-3236 or Supervisor Tonya Lawrence at (704) 370-3257. Services include rapid re-housing, eviction prevention, rental assistance, security deposits, and connection to VA benefits.
service_area: Mecklenburg County, North Carolina - Charlotte metro area
notes: SSVF program prioritizes rapid re-housing for homeless veteran households. Additional contact: Sharon Davis (Program Administrator) at (704) 370-3218 or swdavis@ccdoc.org. Fax: (704) 370-3290
